1.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
(concretely) a boy (as active), from the age of infancy to adolescence; by implication, a servant; also (by interch. of sex), a girl (of similar latitude in age)
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
to have affection for (sexually or otherwise)
Mitsrajim, i.e. Upper and Lower Egypt
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)

2.brief: to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
to slaughter an animal (usually in sacrifice)
to smoke, i.e. turn into fragrance by fire (especially as an act of worship)

3.brief: Ephrajim, a son of Joseph; also the tribe descended from him, and its territory
to take (in the widest variety of applications)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the arm (as stretched out), or (of animals) the foreleg; figuratively, force
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, to mend (by stitching), i.e. (figuratively) to cure

4.brief: a rope (as twisted), especially a measuring line; by implication, a district or inheritance (as measured); or a noose (as of cords); figuratively, a company (as if tied together); also a throe (especially of parturition); also ruin
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
to draw, used in a great variety of applications (including to sow, to sound, to prolong, to develop, to march, to remove, to delay, to be tall, etc.)
something intwined, i.e. a string, wreath or foliage
{affection (in a good or a bad sense)}
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
to be high actively, to rise or raise (in various applications, literally or figuratively)
a yoke (as imposed on the neck), literally or figuratively
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the cheek (from its fleshiness); hence, the jaw-bone
to stretch or spread out; by implication, to bend away (including moral deflection); used in a great variety of application
near, with or among; often in general, to

5.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
near, with or among; often in general, to
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
Mitsrajim, i.e. Upper and Lower Egypt
Ashshur, the second son of Shem; also his descendants and the country occupied by them (i.e. Assyria), its region and its empire

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again

6.brief: properly, to twist or whirl (in a circular or spiral manner), i.e. (specifically) to dance, to writhe in pain (especially of parturition) or fear; figuratively, to wait, to pervert
drought; also a cutting instrument (from its destructive effect), as a knife, sword, or other sharp implement
a city (a place guarded by waking or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere encampment or post)
to end, whether intransitive (to cease, be finished, perish) or transitived (to complete, prepare, consume)
properly, separation; by implication, a part of the body, branch of atree, bar forcarrying; figuratively, chief of a city; especially (with prepositional prefix) as an adverb, apart, only, besides

7.brief: a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
to suspend; figuratively (through hesitation) to be uncertain; by implication (of mental dependence) to habituate
near, with or among; often in general, to
properly, the top; specifically, the highest (i.e. God); also (adverb) aloft, to Jehovah
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to be high actively, to rise or raise (in various applications, literally or figuratively)

8.brief: to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
Ephrajim, a son of Joseph; also the tribe descended from him, and its territory
properly, to shield; encompass with; figuratively, to rescue, to hand safely over (i.e. surrender)
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
Admah, a place near the Dead Sea
to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
Tseboim or Tsebijim, a place in Palestine
to turn about or over; by implication, to change, overturn, return, pervert
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
properly, to intertwine or contract, i.e. (by implication) to shrivel (as with heat); figuratively, to be deeply affected with passion (love or pity)

9.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
to decay, i.e. (causatively) ruin (literally or figuratively)
Ephrajim, a son of Joseph; also the tribe descended from him, and its territory

strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
properly, the nearest part, i.e. the center, whether literal, figurative or adverbial (especially with preposition)
sacred (ceremonially or morally); (as noun) God (by eminence), an angel, a saint, a sanctuary
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
a city (a place guarded by waking or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere encampment or post)

10.brief: properly, the hind part; generally used as an adverb or conjunction, after (in various senses)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
to shudder with terror; hence, to fear; also to hasten (with anxiety)
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)

a sea (as breaking in noisy surf) or large body of water; specifically (with the article), the Mediterranean Sea; sometimes a large river, or an artifical basin; locally, the west, or (rarely) the south

11.brief: to shudder with terror; hence, to fear; also to hasten (with anxiety)
Mitsrajim, i.e. Upper and Lower Egypt
a dove (apparently from the warmth of their mating)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
Ashshur, the second son of Shem; also his descendants and the country occupied by them (i.e. Assyria), its region and its empire
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

12.brief: to revolve, surround, or border; used in various applications, literally and figuratively
literally a failure of flesh, i.e. emaciation; figuratively, hypocrisy
Ephrajim, a son of Joseph; also the tribe descended from him, and its territory
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
Jehudah (or Judah), the name of five Israelites; also of the tribe descended from the first, and of its territory
properly, iteration or continuance; used only adverbially (with or without preposition), again, repeatedly, still, more
to tramp about, i.e. ramble (free or disconsolate)
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
sacred (ceremonially or morally); (as noun) God (by eminence), an angel, a saint, a sanctuary
properly, to build up or support; to foster as a parent or nurse; figuratively to render (or be) firm or faithful, to trust or believe, to be permanent or quiet; morally to be true or certain;
